page.title: 19THE FINZEAN LANDSCAPE.
page.content: The integrated and mixed land use pattern with{arable and rough grazing {combined with commercial plantations, {shelter belts,game coverts and areas {where natural regeneration of pine, {birch and alder are deliberately {encouraged,}combine to form a pleasing landscape.The valley is intersected by the River Feugh and{heather}grows on the hill tops,the land rising from about 90m on the East to 354m on the West. {Seven small blocks of hardwood trees recently planted will provide shelter in coming years and break up some of the more intensively used farmland. The main damage caused by{death duty {taxation}and the wartime fellings of timber have now been repaired.There is less timber growing than in 1914.
